text: [Music]
let's talk about the difference between
past simple and present perfect past
simple is for a specific time in the
past and present perfect is for non
specific time in the past or from the
past to the present the time expression
will help you know which one to use time
expression for simple past yesterday I
went to the store yesterday last last
week last year last month I went to the
store last week ago
three years ago two days ago I went to
the store two days ago in 2010 I lived
in New York in 2010 simple past
questions when when did you go to the
store I went to the store yesterday
let's practice did you work yesterday
yes I worked yesterday very good
did you work yesterday respond very good
last week last month did you work last
week yes I worked last week
very good did you work last week respond
very good though
two years ago three years ago did you
live in Dallas three years ago yes I
lived in Dallas three years ago very
good
where did you live three years ago
respond very good in 2010 did you work
in 2010 yes I worked in 2010 very good
where did you work in 2010 respond very
good when when did you go to the store I
went to the store yesterday very good
when did you go to the store respond
very good now let's talk about present
perfect we use have have you ever lived
in New York yes I have lived in New York
nonspecific past no specific time in the
last time expressions ever and never for
nonspecific pasts question have you ever
been there you answer yes I have been
there before no specific time I have
been there once or twice now from past
to present in my life questions how long
how long have you been working here you
answer with four or since I have been
working here for ten years or I have
been working here since 2010 question
with lately have you seen your family
lately you answer negative no I haven't
seen my family for two years or using in
in is only correct for the negative
response I haven't seen my family in two
years
have you ever been to China no I've
never been to China very good have you
ever been to China respond very good
have you ever been to California yes
I've been to California before how many
times have you been to California I've
been to California twice
very good have you ever been to
California respond how many times have
you been to California respond very good
question how long how long have you been
working here I've been working here for
ten years
very good how long have you been working
here
respond very good question of lately
have you seen your sister lately no I
haven't seen my sister lately actually I
haven't seen her in two years
very good have you seen your sister
lately respond very good let's talk
about yet and already we use yet for a
question we need to use have have eaten
have you eaten yet use present perfect
with questions with yet yet is for the
question and the negative have you eaten
yet no I haven't eaten yet and yet goes
at the end of the sentence when you guys
are positive used already and it goes in
the middle before the action yes I've
already eaten let's talk about some
differences with already and yet you
will hear this is preferred have you
eaten you have a question no I haven't
eaten yet negative and positive yes I've
already but you might hear a question
with already have you already eaten the
difference with question with already is
because
you think the responses yes you're
confirming an idea you have have you
already eaten because I think you happy
and I want to confirm sometimes you'll
hear
have you eaten already but already
before the action is prefer it's better
and sometimes people don't use have with
yet they'll use did did you eat yet have
you eaten yet is more correct like you
might hear did you eat yet and in Texas
you might hear she get
